verses.roman:
"śivānandera 'prakṛti', putra--yāvat ethāya
āmāra avaśeṣa-pātra tārā yena pāya"

synonyms: śivānandera—of Śivānanda Sena; prakṛti—wife; putra—sons; yāvat—as long as; ethāya—here; āmāra—My; avaśeṣa-pātra—plate of the remnants of food; tārā—all of them; yena—must; pāya—get.
translation: "As long as Śivānanda Sena's wife and children stay in Jagannātha Purī," He said, "they must be given the remnants of My food."
